subject: Do not fail on publishing command
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-09 18:42:13.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Do not fail on publishing command

If no documents are published to /draft, the "cp -a" would fail, rewrite
it so that it always succeeds.

If any command fails, nothing gets uploaded ;(

Change-Id: Ib9c6254504f868fd1a8eb772d5df9651448adc42
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Do not fail on publishing command

If no documents are published to /draft, the "cp -a" would fail, rewrite
it so that it always succeeds.

If any command fails, nothing gets uploaded ;(

Change-Id: Ib9c6254504f868fd1a8eb772d5df9651448adc42

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary checks for encrypted types

Change I6ba62a58ac62a3b7bfb2b9d4d18b37ef458b616c makes it unnecessary
to explicitly check that a volume is encrypted prior to invoking the
volume_encryption_metadata_get function. This change cleans up the
single existing invocation of that function in the API contrib
modules. The unit tests are also updated to reflect this change.

Change-Id: I3b8aef67bd6e70f570a39c90175ae6ceaedc4386

subject: Use a small coroutine in the conductor to iterate over jobs
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-20 00:12:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use a small coroutine in the conductor to iterate over jobs

Move the code that sets/clears the stop event, waits on the timeout
and iterates over jobs to its own miniature coroutine and have
the main run() method call into that instead. This makes the run
method more clear by moving the code that does the checks to its
own routine; making the run method just handle dispatches and
dispatch outcomes.

Change-Id: Ic393207ddfc333cc3e92825d34db7ca2e143c072
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-03-21 00:14:23.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/conductors/backends/impl_blocking.py'], 'message': 'Use a small coroutine in the conductor to iterate over jobs

Move the code that sets/clears the stop event, waits on the timeout
and iterates over jobs to its own miniature coroutine and have
the main run() method call into that instead. This makes the run
method more clear by moving the code that does the checks to its
own routine; making the run method just handle dispatches and
dispatch outcomes.

Change-Id: Ic393207ddfc333cc3e92825d34db7ca2e143c072
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Use a small coroutine in the conductor to iterate over jobs

Move the code that sets/clears the stop event, waits on the timeout
and iterates over jobs to its own miniature coroutine and have
the main run() method call into that instead. This makes the run
method more clear by moving the code that does the checks to its
own routine; making the run method just handle dispatches and
dispatch outcomes.

Change-Id: Ic393207ddfc333cc3e92825d34db7ca2e143c072

subject: Make kubectl use internal apiserver address
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-10 01:34:39.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/templates/heat-kubernetes/kubecluster.yaml'], 'message': 'Make kubectl use internal apiserver address

The kubectl tool should not use the floating IP address to communicate with
the rest of Kubernetes.  While this works in devstack with masquarade rules,
it does not work in real production environments.  The first step is to
expose the internal address via heat outputs so we can access it via kubectl.

Change-Id: I29ea29f5ea2e32b70ad2831b46e1c4ec975dfd0a
Partial-Bug: #1453472
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make kubectl use internal apiserver address

The kubectl tool should not use the floating IP address to communicate with
the rest of Kubernetes.  While this works in devstack with masquarade rules,
it does not work in real production environments.  The first step is to
expose the internal address via heat outputs so we can access it via kubectl.

Change-Id: I29ea29f5ea2e32b70ad2831b46e1c4ec975dfd0a
Partial-Bug: #1453472

subject: Decouple trustee user from keystone_authtoken
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-24 02:08:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Decouple trustee user from keystone_authtoken

This change moves the configuration of the trustee user used in the
trusts deferred auth method to explicit configuration items in
heat.conf, to reduce coupling with keystone's keystone_authtoken
configuration. The keystone_authtoken user is now only used if an
explicit trustee user isn't configured. In addition to this change, heat
can work with keystone_authtoken.auth_uri setting that does not have a
version.

Change-Id: Ifc6e17e2b66006edeada44fe77a16cc511030a86
Closes-Bug: #1446918
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-04-24 18:38:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Decouple trustee user from keystone_authtoken

This change moves the configuration of the trustee user used in the
trusts deferred auth method to explicit configuration items in
heat.conf, to reduce coupling with keystone's keystone_authtoken
configuration. The keystone_authtoken user is now only used if an
explicit trustee user isn't configured. In addition to this change, heat
can work with keystone_authtoken.auth_uri setting that does not have a
version.

commit_message:
Decouple trustee user from keystone_authtoken

This change moves the configuration of the trustee user used in the
trusts deferred auth method to explicit configuration items in
heat.conf, to reduce coupling with keystone's keystone_authtoken
configuration. The keystone_authtoken user is now only used if an
explicit trustee user isn't configured. In addition to this change, heat
can work with keystone_authtoken.auth_uri setting that does not have a
version.

Change-Id: Ifc6e17e2b66006edeada44fe77a16cc511030a86
Closes-Bug: #1446918

commit_message:
Limit router gw ports' stateful fixed IPs to one per address family

Validate a router's gateway port during a router update by ensuring
it has no more than one v4 fixed IP and one v6 (statefully-assigned)
fixed IP.

Note that there is no limit on v6 addresses from SLAAC and
DHCPv6-stateless subnets as they are automatically allocated.

Change-Id: I6a328048b99af39ab9497fd9f265d1a9b95b7148
Closes-Bug: 1438819
Partially-implements: blueprint multiple-ipv6-prefixes

commit_message:
Add working eventlet py3.3 and py3.4 version (WIP)

Version 0.17.3 is supposed to work on py3.3 and py3.4
so include it as an extra (not required) installation
in our py3.3 and py3.4 tox environments so that it gets
pulled in and tested.

Change-Id: I75bc0184921f4aea873c521d95d0db65bec392bd

subject: Fixes Nova NOVNC and Consoleauth Startup Failure

Previously these services would not start because the start
script requires the associated log file to exist. The default
settings for these 2 log files are blank causing the failure.
Since the log files are not required for the services to start,
this patch removes the parameter requirement from both start
scripts.

(cherry picked from commit 8b6d7b44b8a5adb6078ab3ffa1ddec67968e5699)

Change-Id: I5bfc3ec95875e0db8c533028e2d9b888b1b6c757
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixes Nova NOVNC and Consoleauth Startup Failure

Previously these services would not start because the start
script requires the associated log file to exist. The default
settings for these 2 log files are blank causing the failure.
Since the log files are not required for the services to start,
this patch removes the parameter requirement from both start
scripts.

(cherry picked from commit 8b6d7b44b8a5adb6078ab3ffa1ddec67968e5699)

Change-Id: I5bfc3ec95875e0db8c533028e2d9b888b1b6c757

commit_message:
Add a novnc container running the novnc-proxy.

All VNC-specific configuration bits are moved from nova-api-base to
nova-compute and the new nova-novncproxy and nova-consoleauth
containers. The compose specification has been updated to reflect this.

A future patch will make the desired backend configurable (spice/vnc).

Blueprint: novnc-container
(cherry picked from commit 5ffc66cd69e1cda087056da25ab25548dacb1d32)

Change-Id: I2e5684378f6e279c69d6a2898f1ac6212799e3dd

commit_message:
Allow configuration of Nova SQLAlchemy options

Add variables for the following 3 nova.conf vars:
max_overflow (default 10)
max_pool_size (default 5)
pool_timeout (default 30)

This allows for sql tuning to better support bulk operations
(boot/delete) with the ability to define custom values in nova.conf
based on business needs.

Change-Id: Ic427e6822f636a304cbbfaab5ac74a13e912da0f
Closes-Bug: #1447389

commit_message:
Create a centos-rdo-k-base package

Now we set .buildconf to centos-rdo-k- to create Kilo packages or
centos-rdo-j- to create Juno packages.

Change-Id: If3c6331dc621e404f494ecb267b621718410e900
Partially-implements: blueprint port-kilo

commit_message:
Optionally do caching/updating of flowdetail in storage

Instead of having the provided flowdetail be a write-through cache-like
object have the storage layer just optionally defer to the backend storage
layer to do this type of caching (if it so prefers/desires to) so that
this layer becomes simpler and is more resistent to bugs and is more easy
to understand/read.

Part of blueprint lb-not-collections

Change-Id: I36db13dc4c762fa6099e3438a649d13f3161cf00

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-06 19:55:50.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/context.py', 'sahara/openstack/common/fileutils.py'], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I5e4746b58e11bf56957f10517d484c173335dfc9
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I5e4746b58e11bf56957f10517d484c173335dfc9

", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-04-10 23:37:59.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tests/plugin/interface/test_secret_store.py', 'barbican/plugin/crypto/manager.py', 'barbican/plugin/util/utils.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/util/test_utils.py', 'barbican/plugin/interface/secret_store.py', 'barbican/plugin/interface/certificate_manager.py'], 'message': "Expose root cause plugin exceptions

Stevedore was being used to both discover configured plugins and to
create instances of these plugins. If the plugin's __init__() function
raised an exception however, stevedore logged the exception but
otherwise kept processing plugins in the list. The logger also is
disabled so no stack trace is seen in the log file, hence the init
error is swallowed. It wasn't until the plugin was searched for later
in the flow that an error was appearent to the client, but the original
root cause of the issue was not found. This CR creates these plugins
outside of stevedore so that issues are immediately raised for
attention, as these represent configuration issues that must be fixed
for proper operation.

Change-Id: I2fd533302ac5e0364aee6e24fd03fcf962c7a3ef
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Expose root cause plugin exceptions

Stevedore was being used to both discover configured plugins and to
create instances of these plugins. If the plugin's __init__() function
raised an exception however, stevedore logged the exception but
otherwise kept processing plugins in the list. The logger also is
disabled so no stack trace is seen in the log file, hence the init
error is swallowed. It wasn't until the plugin was searched for later
in the flow that an error was appearent to the client, but the original
root cause of the issue was not found. This CR creates these plugins
outside of stevedore so that issues are immediately raised for
attention, as these represent configuration issues that must be fixed
for proper operation.

Change-Id: I2fd533302ac5e0364aee6e24fd03fcf962c7a3ef

commit_message:
Fix flavor issues in samples

Change all absent flavors to existing in gates jobs. To allow
functional testing of samples in gate.

Change-Id: Ic88da1d00b6d47e5251623a25dd4ef8fa5682084

Fix validation for rps parameter

The rpc parameter range was extended from >1 to >0.

commit_message:
[VMware] Using ShutdownGuest instead of PowerOffVM_Task, if vmtools was installed.

PowerOffVM_Task is a dangerous operation, while ShutdownGuest are more secure.
Using ShutdownGuest instead of PowerOffVM_Task, if vmtools was installed.
Closes-Bug: #1445858

Change-Id: I7a8aaa3ca993ef997233387d02e26c1dc94fd67b

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-14 16:45:49.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/api/v1/test_volumes.py', 'cinder/api/v2/volumes.py', 'cinder/api/v1/volumes.py', 'cinder/tests/api/v2/test_volumes.py'], 'message': "Fix handling of serialized data in filtering of volumes

Commit 4aaf40ba1aab4d7c347b05750d0fe21f8d1bcc68 has introduced a bug.
'ast.literal_eval(v)' throws exception 'SyntaxError' if 'v' is an expression
such as UUID '920da701-93c1-4178-9f1a-ef1c7a8a384d', 'd-', or 'd+'.
Catch the 'SyntaxError' exception in addition to 'ValueError' and
assume 'v' is a string. So the API can handle the request successfully
rather than returning a '500' error code.

Closes-Bug: #1406504
(cherry picked from commit f39eeebf6eca2745b83a79d2a0def57a126846e7)

Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/api/v1/test_volumes.py
	cinder/tests/api/v2/test_volumes.py

Change-Id: Ib50cf3be41ae96ed1f9ef0463ced71443e59061c
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix handling of serialized data in filtering of volumes

Commit 4aaf40ba1aab4d7c347b05750d0fe21f8d1bcc68 has introduced a bug.
'ast.literal_eval(v)' throws exception 'SyntaxError' if 'v' is an expression
such as UUID '920da701-93c1-4178-9f1a-ef1c7a8a384d', 'd-', or 'd+'.
Catch the 'SyntaxError' exception in addition to 'ValueError' and
assume 'v' is a string. So the API can handle the request successfully
rather than returning a '500' error code.

Closes-Bug: #1406504
(cherry picked from commit f39eeebf6eca2745b83a79d2a0def57a126846e7)

Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/api/v1/test_volumes.py
	cinder/tests/api/v2/test_volumes.py

Change-Id: Ib50cf3be41ae96ed1f9ef0463ced71443e59061c

subject: Remove install of vlan/vconfig from base
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-08 19:46:19.000000000', 'files': ['elements/base/install.d/00-baseline-environment', 'elements/base/pkg-map'], 'message': "Remove install of vlan/vconfig from base

vconfig is actually deprecated in favor of the ip command, and is not
available on some newer distros (RHEL 7 at least). I'm not honestly sure
why it needs to be installed in all images anyway. I traced the origins
of installing the vlan package here all the way back to the first dib
git import from some other repo...so, I don't see any obvious reason why
it needs to be installed.

Change-Id: I272667cf29f5e41c217a26f70937b2842a04f748
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove install of vlan/vconfig from base

vconfig is actually deprecated in favor of the ip command, and is not
available on some newer distros (RHEL 7 at least). I'm not honestly sure
why it needs to be installed in all images anyway. I traced the origins
of installing the vlan package here all the way back to the first dib
git import from some other repo...so, I don't see any obvious reason why
it needs to be installed.

Change-Id: I272667cf29f5e41c217a26f70937b2842a04f748

commit_message:
Allow rexports for targets with Datera

Sometimes due to timing, rexporting a target would fail. This will
verify with Datera if a target already exists, or if it should recreate
an export.

Change-Id: I9c40603cbb525c23e010285bdc66efaaaf4be142
Closes-Bug: #1452838

Sync tempest plugin with latest tempest

Sync our Tempest plugin to latest state of tempest repo because it has
incompatibilities.

commit_message:
Helper scripts for running under Apache2

EXPERIMENTAL support - Helpers for running nova-api and nova-ec2-api
under Apache2 just like keystone.

Inspiration from code in the chef cookbooks:
https://github.com/rcbops-cookbooks/nova/tree/master/files/default

These files are used by the following devstack review:
I9fc0c601db2776d3e9084be84065e728e3f5d414

Partially Implements: blueprint run-nova-services-under-apache2
Change-Id: Idd7d3d1b3cc5770cdecea7afe6db3c89d5b2c0d0

commit_message:
Switch to _set_instance_obj_error_state in build_and_run_instance

Since we're guaranteed to have an object in this code path use
_set_instance_obj_error_state rather than _set_instance_error_state.
This updates the instance object appropriately which is proper to do and
also assists testing which checks the state of an object after an error.

Change-Id: I1e2753825816016b2b87ae19e7873dbf1d7cb157

commit_message:
unify libvirt driver checks for qemu

There are multiple features that are only available with qemu.
It makes no sense to have a separate constant for each feature
when they're all looking for the same thing.

There is currently no list of libvirt hypervisor drivers, so
we start such a list.  This is not intended to be exhaustive,
but rather only for those drivers that need special handling.

Change-Id: I3b9546debb3c5bdca13926005a7664c701c6fb9a

commit_message:
Use iptables zone to separate different ip_conntrack

ip_conntrack causes security group rule failures when packets share
the same 5-tuple. Use iptables zone option to separate different
conntrack zone. Currently this patch only works for OVS agent.

Co-authored-by: shihanzhang <shihanzhang@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I90b4d2485e3e491f496dfb7bdee03d57f393be35
Partial-Bug: #1359523

[{'created': '2014-11-27 14:15:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add murano base for murano benchmarks

commit_message:
Add MuranoPackage context

  - Add murano context that can upload package to Murano from
    specific path.
  - Add to rally-jobs/extra/ base structure and first Murano
    package, that is used in gates for testing purpose.

Co-Authored-By: Roman Vasilets <rvasilets@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sergey Murashov <smurashov@mirantis.com>

subject: Allow for decommissioning a board via a .tombstone file
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-06 04:17:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add a connection validation check for a .tombstone file

In order to make it possible to stop creation of a jobboard
in a clean manner, allow for a .tombstone file to be exist
which will stop a jobboard from being used if it exists. If
such a file exists in the location the jobboard will try to
use for recv/posting jobs it will not be allowed to finalize
the connection process and will abort connecting instead.

Change-Id: I9c8098b1eee060d9d34f33f68ab56de089245341
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-05-07 01:04:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow for decommissioning a board via a .tombstone file

In order to make it possible to stop new postings and
further connections to a decommissioned jobboard
in a clean manner, allow for a .tombstone file to be exist
which will stop a jobboard from being connected to
and stops further postings from occurring if the tombstone
path exists.

It tries to be passive about this and does not stop further
iteration, consuming, claiming on jobs that already exist
on that board (but instead allows for further usage to be
disallowed, making it possible to stop future usage). This
means the board can be offically decommissioned and removed
sometime in the future.

Change-Id: I9c8098b1eee060d9d34f33f68ab56de089245341

commit_message:
Allow for decommissioning a board via a .tombstone file

In order to make it possible to stop new postings and
further connections to a decommissioned jobboard
in a clean manner, allow for a .tombstone file to be exist
which will stop a jobboard from being connected to
and stops further postings from occurring if the tombstone
path exists.

It tries to be passive about this and does not stop further
iteration, consuming, claiming on jobs that already exist
on that board (but instead allows for further usage to be
disallowed, making it possible to stop future usage). This
means the board can be offically decommissioned and removed
sometime in the future.

Change-Id: I9c8098b1eee060d9d34f33f68ab56de089245341

commit_message:
Allow for skipping the squashing of existing system configs

Setting 'OVERWRITE_SYSTEM_CONF_DIR' to no would allow you to keep a
rolling aio install.

Closes-Bug: 1453234
Change-Id: I48b8632a816709e536b4f644ab8549e896cbe61f

commit_message:
Clean up ComputeManager._get_instance_nw_info

The private method '_get_instance_nw_info' of ComputeManager
make no sense, it just call self.network_api.get_instance_nw_info
again. Remove it, unify all methods of ComputeManager to use
self.network_api.get_instance_nw_info and update the related
test cases.

Remove the asserting admin context logic, because it come from
I5bc35632ca382d011eb42e738140ba54d9cdc93f, it's useless any more.

Change-Id: Ica58122c60c9e2d3e6740d458559ddf4b5a652be

commit_message:
Remove use of contextlib.nested

Removed use of contextlib.nested call from codebase, as it has been
deprecated since Python 2.7.

There are also known issues with contextlib.nested that were addressed
by the native support for multiple "with" variables. For instance, if
the first object is created but the second one throws an exception,
the first object's __exit__ is never called. For more information see
https://docs.python.org/2/library/contextlib.html#contextlib.nested
contextlib.nested is also not compatible with Python 3.

This is the first patch in a series for removing use of
contextlib.nested.

Added hacking check to catch if any new instances are added to
the codebase.

Line continuation markers (e.g. '\') had to be used or syntax
errors were thrown. While using parentheses is the preferred way
for multiple line statements, but in case of long with statements
backslashes are acceptable.

Partial-Bug: 1428424
Change-Id: I171fbdb89892a3d4548bf2ca52f4a7dd9ef8dccb

commit_message:
Make Docker client timeout configurable

To support long running Docker operations we need to increase our
timeout, but a good value for the timeout will change per deployment.
So, add it as a config option so that it can be tweaked as necessary.

Change-Id: Ie53fa5086e73111bf9f42dbf596172af8d936cf0
Closes-Bug: #1450559

[{'created': '2014-12-23 00:44:48.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/image/image_utils.py', 'cinder/tests/test_image_utils.py'], 'message': "Perform fsync on glance image fetched to tempfile

There's a known bug where sometimes images downloaded from glance to a
file prior to conversion into raw format may end up being corrupted.

The root cause of this is because qemu-img uses fiemap to read blocks
from said file, but it's not using FIEMAP_FLAG_SYNC.  The result is
that if there are blocks in the kernel page_cache that haven't made it
to disk yet, they're skipped in the conversion.

This introduces a workaround config option.  This config option
defaults to True (meaning that the fsync() will happen).  Environments
that have verified they have the fixed version of qemu they can turn
this off.

Distro status can be tracked at:
    https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Bug1368815

Note: this is heavily inspired by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/141259
but I can't revive it for some reason.

Change-Id: Id6ecf8d8eb34ed15b6c9241aea7b52296328907f

Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <dims@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Perform fsync on glance image fetched to tempfile

There's a known bug where sometimes images downloaded from glance to a
file prior to conversion into raw format may end up being corrupted.

The root cause of this is because qemu-img uses fiemap to read blocks
from said file, but it's not using FIEMAP_FLAG_SYNC.  The result is
that if there are blocks in the kernel page_cache that haven't made it
to disk yet, they're skipped in the conversion.

This introduces a workaround config option.  This config option
defaults to True (meaning that the fsync() will happen).  Environments
that have verified they have the fixed version of qemu they can turn
this off.

Distro status can be tracked at:
    https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Bug1368815

Note: this is heavily inspired by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/141259
but I can't revive it for some reason.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Id6ecf8d8eb34ed15b6c9241aea7b52296328907f
Closes-Bug: #1368815
Co-Authored-By: John Griffith <john.griffith8@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <dims@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Update the specs process for Liberty

This adds explicit wording around the fact we will not use a deadline
for specs submission during Liberty. It also adds wording around the
new requirement for a less heavy-weight template to be filled in
when submitting a spec.

Change-Id: Id54550fb4314117db8fcfea90dd0627899e80c74

commit_message:
Enabling volume replication on PureISCSIDriver

Purity implements asynch replication using arrays
The smallest unit of replication is a Protection Group(PG)
During setup, a protection group is configured for replication
Adding/removing a volume from a PG adds/removes replication

Refactored all calls to self._array --> self.get_primary_array(volume)
The provider_location property on both volumes and snapshots will be used to store state

Implements: blueprint cinder-pureiscsidriver-volume-replication
Change-Id: I34fb7c5dc071c07575daf24d2fe111cd41518b39

commit_message:
Tenant can't set readonly metadata to True

Volume has a 'readonly' metadata, which has a
default value False. Tenant can use command
"cinder metadata set" to set it to True. This
command updates the database sccessfully. However,
when the tenant shows the volume, the 'readonly'
metadata is still False. This is because 'readonly'
belongs to admin metadata, when tenant updates
'readonly' metadata, just change 'volume_metadata'
table in db but not 'volume_admin_metadata'.

Change-Id: I07d3843586e1d1ffe9f1384a9429f471a4f1d100
Closes-Bug: #1421538

commit_message:
Wrong logging when volume type quota exceed

When create a volume type volume, if the quota
has exceed, we can get a QuotaExceed exception.
However, when logging the exception, it compared
with the none type quota, and give a wrong log.

Change-Id: Ice7ac2be5366f6834b9d876d63c573cf51542eb8
Closes-Bug: 1419261
Related-Bug: 1418936

commit_message:
Create a type volume also update none type quota

None volume type quota is always changing when
create a type volume. This is because when update
a type's quota, the none volume type quota is
changed at the same time.

Change-Id: Ieb679b6271f6c1d3e88348994eaf5559e7ae1a76
Closes-Bug: #1418936
Related-Bug: #1419261

commit_message:
Correct docstring info on two parameters

Two parameters were documented as unused but in subsequent patches the
parameters have now become used.  Update the docstring to no longer say
that:
 * admin_password
 * injected_files
are unused.

Change-Id: I94522c35d2ee464b796502662cf50bd352c9ab15

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-07 11:27:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Revert "rtstool on Ubuntu installs in /usr/local/bin"

This reverts commit c85bd876d3ae4b6e29bb040a49e43d3ba46b6039.

cinder-rtstool is installed by setup.py/setup.cfg, the same
way that cinder-api, cinder-volume, etc., are installed.

If it is installing in /usr/local/bin/, that sounds like a

should not have a responsibility to cover /usr/local/bin/.

commit_message:
Revert "rtstool on Ubuntu installs in /usr/local/bin"

This reverts commit c85bd876d3ae4b6e29bb040a49e43d3ba46b6039.

cinder-rtstool is installed by setup.py/setup.cfg, the same
way that cinder-api, cinder-volume, etc., are installed.

If it is installing in /usr/local/bin/, that sounds like a
packaging or deployment bug.  The upstream Cinder package
should not have a responsibility to cover /usr/local/bin/.

(Ubuntu packages install this binary correctly in
/usr/bin/ anyway per Ubuntu packaging rules, AFAICT.)

Related-Bug: #1402076
SecurityImpact: rootwrap configuration
Change-Id: Iad1682abb0f2f004f559090358a38a845908fdf4

commit_message:
Switch drivers to use execute from cinder utils

Change is needed for use rootwrap daemon helper by drivers.
This change create common interface for command execution,
cinder utils execute will make decision based on config arg,
uses oslo putils or rootwrap daemon client via class helpers
(RootwrapProcessHelper and RootwrapDaemonHelper).

So to use only one approach at the same time, cinder execute
function should be used.

Also related unit tests converted mox -> mock.

Change-Id: Ib019fa18f61f284143f74e9915353c76f557deb0

commit_message:
Add secondary sshpool for san storage drivers

In order to implement volume replication, should add a secondary
ssh connection for communication with the replica storage.

By default, the parameters of the connection such as 'san_ssh_port'
are the same between secondary and primary storage.

DocImpact: another ssh connection for san storage.

Change-Id: Ia19a1cb47019c6a3a4156e81c86592d3e0cb1535

commit_message:
Implement pool-aware for Storwize/SVC driver

Storwize/SVC support for the pool-aware scheduler, will
report all pools exist in the storage.

Change-Id: If4a0159735a1b0afd53afd4640c77c6fbfef4a33

commit_message:
Fix assertEqual argument order in tests/ root dir

The assertEqual using incorrect argument order (observed, expected),
which causes the error message about mismatch to be reversed if the
test case fails. Change it to (expected, observed).

This patch fixes these issues in root dir or cinder/tests. There will
be following patches each fixies a directory in cinder/tests.

Change-Id: I5467520d137426b90cb8f4462b4fd0a1fe1065c0
Partial-Bug: #1259292

commit_message:
Proof of concept for reset-state-with-driver

Implementation to change python-cinderclient reset-state to
involve the driver. This is a WIP.

This code does not involve a new API for the driver as
originally proposed. Instead, it uses existing calls for
terminate_connection() and detach() when the reset-state
command is used to set state to available.

This patch does not adress Nova issues.
Note that there is a FIXME comment for valid_status that
should be cleaned up before the final patch.

Change-Id: I136b5cb86f247dd2af53c91b5067ee67dc85fe26
Related-Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/reset-state-with-driver

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-16 19:11:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixing 3PAR connection name cache error

The 3PAR driver had a connection name cache in 3PAR common.  If
Cinder was restarted or the common object was destroyed the cache
was lost.  Instead of having the cache in 3PAR common, the 3PAR
driver can query the backend to see if there is a host already
available.  Replacing the name cache with a backend query had minimal
impact on performance of the driver and eliminates the problem of the
cache being destroyed/lost.

Closes-Bug: #1275979

Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/test_hp3par.py
	cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_common.py
	cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_fc.py
	cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_iscsi.py

commit_message:
Fixing 3PAR connection name cache error

The 3PAR driver had a connection name cache in 3PAR common.  If
Cinder was restarted or the common object was destroyed the cache
was lost.  Instead of having the cache in 3PAR common, the 3PAR
driver can query the backend to see if there is a host already
available.  Replacing the name cache with a backend query had minimal
impact on performance of the driver and eliminates the problem of the
cache being destroyed/lost.

Closes-Bug: #1275979
Change-Id: If9a22b64be0b4fd74800dd2f0a4ab421c4c7ede9

commit_message:
fix rabbitmq userdata template to create metadata

A metadata file is created by the install_rabbit.sh script, which is
being supplied by userdata properly.  However, the directory that the
script tries to populate does not seem to exist.  Fixing script template
to create the entire directory hierarchy rather than just the specific
directory.

Change-Id: I3160d0a1dc29025e2aae17549a67e1b16422c527
Closes-Bug: 1453266

commit_message:
Add check for vios from another cluster node

When retrieving the vios uuids of the cluster we have to throw
out any vios that is on another node, since we won't have
their uuid or url.

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-08 18:05:43.000000000', 'files': ['files/rpms-suse/general', 'files/rpms/general', 'files/apts/general', 'files/apts/horizon', 'files/rpms-suse/swift', 'tools/fixup_stuff.sh', 'files/apts/swift', 'files/rpms/swift', 'files/rpms/horizon', 'files/rpms-suse/horizon', 'README.md'], 'message': "Stop installing nose and pylint from distros

on some platforms, and on some of those platforms (at least CentOS
6.x) you can't resolve dependencies on python-setuptools properly if
you've forcibly removed it already (as we do on our CI workers). It

commit_message:
Stop installing nose and pylint from distros

The distro packages of nose and pylint depend on python-setuptools
on some platforms, and on some of those platforms (at least CentOS
6.x) you can't resolve dependencies on python-setuptools properly if
you've forcibly removed it already (as we do on our CI workers). It
appears that any current upstream use of these tools in relation to
DevStack-based testing is now relying on tox and pip to obtain them
instead.

Conflicts:
	files/debs/swift
	files/rpms-suse/general
	files/rpms/general
	files/rpms/horizon

Change-Id: Ibd16ac550c90364115caf57fae4f5f4cb5d5f238
(cherry picked from commit 091b42b7da7650d528bb5f88ec411a04af3da828)

commit_message:
Stop installing nose and pylint from distros

The distro packages of nose and pylint depend on python-setuptools
on some platforms, and on some of those platforms (at least CentOS
6.x) you can't resolve dependencies on python-setuptools properly if
you've forcibly removed it already (as we do on our CI workers). It
appears that any current upstream use of these tools in relation to
DevStack-based testing is now relying on tox and pip to obtain them
instead.

Change-Id: Ibd16ac550c90364115caf57fae4f5f4cb5d5f238

commit_message:
Fixes use of dict methods for Python3

In Python3 the dict.keys(), dict.values() and dict.items() methods have
been changed to return iterators instead of lists. This causes issues
with code that expects a list.

bp python3
Change-Id: Id0d55ea4b992666848af1b1a055bc7841548cc6a

commit_message:
Correct multiple DNS servers and tolerate missing NTP

Multiple DNS servers in astute.yaml were not valid input
in the UI because they were missing a comma.

NTP config from system tests removes NTP2 and NTP3 servers.
Modified nailgun settings to permit empty NTP server
configuration.

Change-Id: Ie316e37817e889553840f4923d1426cb54e1589c
Closes-Bug: #1449026

commit_message:
Respect network type in upgrade_ha_one_controller_env test

Respect different types of networks when checking services is up
after deployment in test upgrade_ha_one_controller_env test.
Should wait for 7 nova services if neutron network enabled
instead of 10 when nova used.

Change-Id: I989603b71c8a2df207c65b98e5c57bd66adbe3a6
Closes-Bug: #1453246

commit_message:
view hypervisor details rest api should be allowed for non-admins

The current call to show hypervisor is broken and expects the
user to have admin privileges always.It does not allow non-
admin users to view hypervisor details. This should be
controlled based on the rule defined in the policy.json rather
than have the permissions mandated programmatically. This bug
is caused due to regression and was working earlier.So the
changes proposed here is merely retaining the older behavior.
To ensure that this works as before, the context passed to the
db api layer is elevated so that it passes the requires_admin_
context check that is present in the db layer.

Change-Id: I50437788aac72608998cf9c24d4d562b1ff20301
Closes-Bug: 1447084
(cherry picked from commit 6be11856c6ac1cbd611cea894a0e26165ee5c5a5)

commit_message:
Stop installing nose and pylint from distros

The distro packages of nose and pylint depend on python-setuptools
on some platforms, and on some of those platforms (at least CentOS
6.x) you can't resolve dependencies on python-setuptools properly if
you've forcibly removed it already (as we do on our CI workers). It
appears that any current upstream use of these tools in relation to
DevStack-based testing is now relying on tox and pip to obtain them
instead.

Change-Id: Ibd16ac550c90364115caf57fae4f5f4cb5d5f238
(cherry picked from commit 091b42b7da7650d528bb5f88ec411a04af3da828)

commit_message:
Fix unit tests spam output

Some of unit tests print logs to stdout. Tests output should be clear
and contain only necessary information. Debug output should not be mixed
with tests output.

Change-Id: Ia886998693ce559b270f52c3d9f2ac6062e09a67
Closes-Bug: #1449073

commit_message:
Stop installing nose and pylint from distros

The distro packages of nose and pylint depend on python-setuptools
on some platforms, and on some of those platforms (at least CentOS
6.x) you can't resolve dependencies on python-setuptools properly if
you've forcibly removed it already (as we do on our CI workers). It
appears that any current upstream use of these tools in relation to
DevStack-based testing is now relying on tox and pip to obtain them
instead.

Conflicts:
	files/debs/swift
	files/rpms-suse/general
	files/rpms/general
	files/rpms/horizon

Change-Id: Ibd16ac550c90364115caf57fae4f5f4cb5d5f238
(cherry picked from commit 091b42b7da7650d528bb5f88ec411a04af3da828)

commit_message:
Test live migrate on a paused instance

Nova change Ib38eaf412cb51a9cbfc443c5ec15c5797265ddae adds support for
doing live migration of a paused instance, this adds the test to cover
that scenario.

This also depends on a series of devstack-gate changes to support
multi-host testing in the experimental queue. Specifically, this is
tested in the check-tempest-dsvm-aiopcpu-full job.

Depends-On: I89b7e390bf1cf4f2eccabca2e31a9d1b6b270677

Co-Authored By: "Matthew Gilliard <matthew.gilliard@hp.com>"
Related-Bug: #1305062

commit_message:
beaker/puppet: install bundle before revoking sudo

To install bundle with `gem install`, we need sudo so let's move the
sudo command *before* revoking sudo in the job.

Change-Id: I46505a045c4d2edbe7e87035a94636a645931501

commit_message:
Fix disconnect_volume issue when find_multipath_device returns None

During disconnect_volume in LibvirtFibreChannelVolumeDriver there is
a chance that find_multipath_device behaves badly and returns None.
When this happens we end up with a failure as we don't check the
return value from find_multipath_device.

Co-Authored-By: Melanie Witt <melwitt@yahoo-inc.com>
Closes-Bug: #1424968
Change-Id: I5a5c7e26b70df237c7446efe8f99ce2304c41ab4

commit_message:
Fix CNA update

An earlier change in pypowervm removed the adapter from the update call.
This change fixes a few remaining items in neutron-powervm that use the
old mechanism for updating.

Change-Id: Icabc395c60cbdb989565771a2b390d16a36815c4

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-03 23:55:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix the volume replication spec

The spec that was originally written for volume replication
was written assuming that Cinder would provide the bulk of the
work to implement volume replication.

After the spec was approved it was decided that a different
approach would be taken to implement volume replication.  It
was decided that Cinder would just provide a framework for
backend drivers to implement volume replication as appropriate
for their storage backend with an extra spec set in the volume type
to indicate that replication should be used for a volume.  The code that was
merged in Juno implemented volume replication using this approach.

Unfortunately, the spec was not updated after these changes were
made to the design which has caused confusion for developers wishing
to implement volume replication.

This commit brings the spec up to date with the merged functionality.

Change-Id: I56311d0471123635197ebfdeb1547007e75bd3f8

commit_message:
Fix the volume replication spec

The spec that was originally written for volume replication
was written assuming that Cinder would provide the bulk of the
work to implement volume replication.

After the spec was approved it was decided that a different
approach would be taken to implement volume replication.  It
was decided that Cinder would just provide a framework for
backend drivers to implement volume replication as appropriate
for their storage backend with an extra spec set in the volume type
to indicate that replication should be used for a volume.  The code that was
merged in Juno implemented volume replication using this approach.

Unfortunately, the spec was not updated after these changes were
made to the design which has caused confusion for developers wishing
to implement volume replication.

This commit brings the spec up to date with the merged functionality.

Change-Id: I56311d0471123635197ebfdeb1547007e75bd3f8

commit_message:
Set vrouter gw when DHCP GW is used

Set vrouter mgmt vip as a default gateway for
public-less nodes in post-deploy when DHCP gateway
not equal to master node ip is used

Closes-Bug: 1452265

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-09 17:02:09.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/eqlx.py', 'cinder/tests/test_eqlx.py'], 'message': 'Fix the eqlx driver to retry on ssh timeout(Backport)

When the ssh session is timing out, the driver
should make attempts to retry based on the value
in eqlx_cli_max_retries. Instead it was raising
the exception and bailing out on a single attempt.

Fixed the driver to raise a different exception
so the ssh sessions can be retried.

Added unit tests to ensure the max retries
happen

Also fixed the actual attempts made in the message

Change-Id: I9bda46f9ef63eec436a381da3c96c09ce77c31ee
Closes-Bug: #1412940 and #1417772
(cherry picked from commit 440beba26d0bc6c27ff837a6772c05a901ec23de and
f5f2ccea52e4d96edb5e9d45fa2398215b5cc732)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix the eqlx driver to retry on ssh timeout(Backport)

When the ssh session is timing out, the driver
should make attempts to retry based on the value
in eqlx_cli_max_retries. Instead it was raising
the exception and bailing out on a single attempt.

Fixed the driver to raise a different exception
so the ssh sessions can be retried.

Added unit tests to ensure the max retries
happen

Also fixed the actual attempts made in the message

Change-Id: I9bda46f9ef63eec436a381da3c96c09ce77c31ee
Closes-Bug: #1412940 and #1417772
(cherry picked from commit 440beba26d0bc6c27ff837a6772c05a901ec23de and
f5f2ccea52e4d96edb5e9d45fa2398215b5cc732)

subject: refactor functional test base class to no inherit from tempest_lib
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-21 13:23:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'refactor functional test base class to no inherit from tempest_lib

Test base classes inheriting outside the existing source tree to
anything higher up the stack than testtools is really an anti
pattern. It makes it *far* less clear what is going on. We really need
to own and understand our base class setup for tests.

This does that unwind, so that we only now call out to tempest_lib in
specific ways (like building clients, using decorators). The timeout
and log capture pieces are pulled inline.

At the end of this we end up with a base test that defines:

 - self.client - a Nova API client
 - self.flavor - a workable flavor for booting guests
 - self.image - a workable image for booting guests
 - self.cli_clients - tempest_lib cli clients

Change-Id: I716be51d7d1825a757934298f06b2f04d64cf0dd

commit_message:
refactor functional test base class to no inherit from tempest_lib

Test base classes inheriting outside the existing source tree to
anything higher up the stack than testtools is really an anti
pattern. It makes it *far* less clear what is going on. We really need
to own and understand our base class setup for tests.

This does that unwind, so that we only now call out to tempest_lib in
specific ways (like building clients, using decorators). The timeout
and log capture pieces are pulled inline.

At the end of this we end up with a base test that defines:

 - self.client - a Nova API client
 - self.flavor - a workable flavor for booting guests
 - self.image - a workable image for booting guests
 - self.cli_clients - tempest_lib cli clients

Change-Id: I716be51d7d1825a757934298f06b2f04d64cf0dd

HDS HNAS Driver fails when FS unhealthy

This patch fixes the error when there is a file system in an
unhealthy HNAS storage pool.

commit_message:
Create initiator id for VMAX iSCSI driver

This is related to Bug #1440427. The fix for that bug only addressed
the issue for the FC driver. The same problem exists for the iSCSI
driver. This patch addressed the problem for the VMAX iSCSI driver.
The initiator id will be created on the array if it does not exist
for the iSCSI driver.

Change-Id: I5df57df122a704066d4d7a1997ac2642b073c9e8
Closes-Bug: #1446443

commit_message:
SMBFS: Add minimum qemu-img version requirement

This patch enforces specific qemu-img versions as minimum
requirements for the SMBFS drivers.

This way, some of the workarounds that were needed because
of qemu-img missing features or bugs related to the VHD/X
formats can be removed.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I9d14e16b1102673847f386e300179ed6d43ab576

commit_message:
Add Multi-connection support to XIV

Add field in cinder.conf to hold a list of management IP addresses to connect
to the XIV backend.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ie4eceb315188765747dc02a0a77b5a1d2c692fb5
Implements: blueprint xiv-multiple-mgmt-ips

subject: Sync latest code from oslo-incubator
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-26 15:28:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use uuidutils from oslo.utils

uuidutils was graduated to oslo.utils.uuidutils. Code from oslo-incubator
can be outdated, so the correct way is usage of uuidutils from oslo.utils

Change-Id: I2f3bf41434591fcfc811ae6dec40ccabd42db741
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-04-20 11:00:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove code duplication

uuidutils was graduated to oslo.utils.uuidutils. Code from oslo-incubator
can be outdated, so the correct way is use uuidutils from oslo.utils

`novaclient.utils.is_integer_like` is similar to
oslo.utils.strutils.is_int_like , which is covered by unit tests, so it would
be nice to switch to code from oslo.utils

Change-Id: I2f3bf41434591fcfc811ae6dec40ccabd42db741

can be outdated, so the correct way is use uuidutils from oslo.utils

commit_message:
Harden our copy of Glance's policy

Most of Glance's current checks are implemented in the API controllers
but in Kilo, Glance added the ability to actually define meaningful
policy rules around images and image members. In an effort to harden
our default config as best as we can, we should check to see if the
user trying to perform some of these actions are either an admin or the
owner of the image.

Change-Id: I2dcf4d828c9be88143174de30a6b59d655ab0539
Closes-bug: 1408363

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-05-08 13:42:06.000000000', 'files': ['stackrc'], 'message': 'Preload updated cirros image

We want to update the master branch of devstack to a new version of

we need to load the new image in the previous branch, i.e. here.

commit_message:
Preload updated cirros image

We want to update the master branch of devstack to a new version of
cirros[1]. In order for the grenade upgrade check to pass on this patch,
we need to load the new image in the previous branch, i.e. here.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/166778

Co-Authored-By: Scott Moser <smoser@ubuntu.com>
Change-Id: Iac9f108d947ff4a51f99c6e8ad9d1ac5b32c000a

commit_message:
Move install_infra before execute build_wheels.sh

The pip_install_gr function in build_wheels.sh use requirements project.
So requirements project must exist before execute build_wheels.sh.
Then we moved install_infra function which install requirements project.

Change-Id: I8f80ecafff0f7e1942731379b70bccac338ea3b3
Closes-Bug: 1453012

subject: Get the indirection_api from the current VersionedObject class
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-06 14:13:47.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/base.py'], 'message': 'Get the indirection_api from the current VersionedObject class

To avoid having to monkey-patch the VersionedObject class from the oslo
library, get the indirection_api from the current self or cls variables
(the class or instance inheriting from the VersionedObject class) in
remotable decorators.

Change-Id: I8fed628e3d82539e477b8b72532858095a9b8ef4
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Get the indirection_api from the current VersionedObject class

To avoid having to monkey-patch the VersionedObject class from the oslo
library, get the indirection_api from the current self or cls variables
(the class or instance inheriting from the VersionedObject class) in
remotable decorators.

Change-Id: I8fed628e3d82539e477b8b72532858095a9b8ef4

commit_message:
Delete the temporary volume if migration fails

Issues resolved in this patch include the following changes:
* A temporary volume is created on the destination host before migrating
the data from the source. However, if the creation of this volume fails,
its record will be left in the database as redundant information. This
patch will remove the database record if the creation fails.

* If attaching the remote dest volme fails at initialize_connection
due to timeout, we need to terminate the connection. Otherwise, the dest
volume will not be released and successfully deleted.

Closes-bug: #1398177
Change-Id: I5bc75bd7652841fddd66481ee001fb682168215c
(cherry picked from commit 5221f181f305336a7a14851e89764af2a3a5bba1)

commit_message:
Set all groups when creating system_user

Previously we had a task in nova_libvirt to add the nova user to the
libvirtd group. The problem with this is that if the user is recreated,
it will be removed from the group, as that group is not specified when
the user is created.

This patch creates and sets additional groups when the user is created
so any recreation will be idempotent.

Change-Id: I62eedca6d417fbf336538452c9869de5b58fb040
Closes-Bug: 1442366

commit_message:
Fix exceptions logging in iSCSI targets

On multiple iSCSI target helpers you could get an unexpected exception
regarding non-ascii chars if the volume name contained unicode
characters.

It could also happen if debugging was enabled and stdout contained unicode
characters.

To fix this we changed to delayed string interpolation and removed any
force type translation of variables on iSCSI targets.

Change-Id: I76bb87ff5f0014f27fda4c4d2bfff7a5e2bf1535
Closes-Bug: #1402078

commit_message:
Enhance list operations with the additional keys and next link

The pagination keys, limit, marker, sort information and the next
link generation have been implemented in volume list operation. This
blueprint extends this feature to other cinder entities, containing
snapshots, volume transfers, consistency group, consistency group
snapshots and backups.

BP link:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/extend-limit-implementations

APIImpact

change-Id: I558cca9d2d0b67f0a80f0a0fb26a4d84e3eec57c

commit_message:
Recap cinderclient to <1.1.2 for stable/juno

Heat's stable/juno branch has an cinderclient upper bound version 1.1.1
and since python-cinderclient's patches get 1.1.1.post100 we can't
create any new patches because
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-python-cinderclient-juno fails with
critical error "Could not load AWSTemplateFormatVersion".

So we change upper bound to <1.1.2 instead of <=1.1.1

Partial-Bug: #1442086
Change-Id: Ic66176638ee2113159a15e30ef26e66fd1112fa2

", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-05-08 16:10:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "beaker: support ssh service name on centos

", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
beaker: support ssh service name on centos

In a previous patch, we added Centos support for Beaker but we forgot
to change the SSH service name.
On ubuntu, service name is ssh, and on RH systems it's sshd.

Also use systemctl on RH because 'service' is not in PATH:
/usr/bin/systemctl
/usr/sbin/service
Since we use sudo without option, we should use systemctl to manage the
service.

Also install `bundle` which is needed by Beaker to run.
This package was installed in the previous image we were using, but not
on this one.

Change-Id: I6be34f2c6a8b4effd49e27dff0fbdeffafc4c5cb

commit_message:
Show visitor "add to glance" command for entries

When looking at glance images, this change adds
a dynamically generated "glance create-image" line
so a user can simply cut and paste that command
to pull the image into their own glance index.

Change-Id: Ie1b203c7ec86b2f2aa625752bd96d8b6b9ef2d16

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9037, 'name': 'Dmitry Ilyin', 'email': 'idv1985@gmail.com', 'username': 'dilyin'}, {'_account_id': 9387, 'name': 'Aleksandr Didenko', 'email': 'adidenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'AD'}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 14774, 'name': 'Fuel TPI CI', 'email': 'pi-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-tpi-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-08 14:15:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Pacemaker service must before corosync

Then corosync running pacemaker service as a separate service (ver:1),
the service pacemaker must be stopped prior to the corosync service.
Then scaling controller nodes, puppet updates corosync.conf and tries
to restart corosync - and hangs as corosync service declines to stop
with an error: "[pcmk ] pcmk_shutdown notice: pcmk_shutdown: Preventing
Corosync shutdown. Please ensure Pacemaker is stopped first."

The solution is:
- to make an additional puppet dependency between corosync.conf ~>
 Exec pacemaker stop ~> Service corosync
Note, that it should be the stop action, not service notify as pacemaker
service must be always started after the corosync one.

This patch fixes the regression introduced with
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/176412/8/deployment/puppet/cluster/manifests/init.pp

Closes-bug: #1417972

Change-Id: Ic50d43507b256c804d06b689adeba93a156ba2a7
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-05-08 14:17:20.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cluster/manifests/init.pp'], 'message': 'Pacemaker must be stopped only before corosync

Then corosync running pacemaker service as a separate service (ver:1),
the service pacemaker must be stopped prior to the corosync service.
Then scaling controller nodes, puppet updates corosync.conf and tries
to restart corosync - and hangs as corosync service declines to stop
with an error: "[pcmk ] pcmk_shutdown notice: pcmk_shutdown: Preventing
Corosync shutdown. Please ensure Pacemaker is stopped first."

The solution is:
- to make an additional puppet dependency between corosync.conf ~>
 Exec pacemaker stop ~> Service corosync
Note, that it should be the stop action, not service notify as pacemaker
service must be always started after the corosync one.

This patch fixes the regression introduced with
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/176412/8/deployment/puppet/cluster/manifests/init.pp

Closes-bug: #1417972

Change-Id: Ic50d43507b256c804d06b689adeba93a156ba2a7
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Pacemaker must be stopped only before corosync

Then corosync running pacemaker service as a separate service (ver:1),
the service pacemaker must be stopped prior to the corosync service.
Then scaling controller nodes, puppet updates corosync.conf and tries
to restart corosync - and hangs as corosync service declines to stop
with an error: "[pcmk ] pcmk_shutdown notice: pcmk_shutdown: Preventing
Corosync shutdown. Please ensure Pacemaker is stopped first."

The solution is:
- to make an additional puppet dependency between corosync.conf ~>
 Exec pacemaker stop ~> Service corosync
Note, that it should be the stop action, not service notify as pacemaker
service must be always started after the corosync one.

This patch fixes the regression introduced with
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/176412/8/deployment/puppet/cluster/manifests/init.pp

Closes-bug: #1417972

Change-Id: Ic50d43507b256c804d06b689adeba93a156ba2a7
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Save image data after setting the data

The image's locations are missing when image's are imported using tasks
because the ImportToStore task is not saving the image metadata after
the import. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I43dec450d5fc4bee2131d78dbe3c2b2373c3f739
Closes-bug: #1453068

commit_message:
Make sure the converted image is imported

Turns out the converted image is being completely ignored. This is
because the `file_path` provided by the ImportToFS task cannot be
overriden by other tasks. In order to fix this, I've dropped all the
extra suffixes that we've been using in favor of working on the actual
`file_path` directly.

Change-Id: Ifbd2308057f33c1f712fa06f9bb3e57f90068fdc
Closes-bug: #1452750

commit_message:
create a more generic work around for cffi & wheels

This is an attempt to fix the cffi vs. wheels bug in a more generic
way by just ensuring that pip has installed cffi with a pip understood
version into the venv before we try to do any builds.

Related-Bug: #1451992

Change-Id: Ibc58668c53933033405b40f79b0e9ffc73a01a6f
(cherry picked from commit 5a59ac7d43bb10a5bbc912b94edea19e1009b675)

[{'created': '2015-05-07 21:59:53.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/astute/tasks.yaml'], 'message': "Remove base os from configure_default_route

configure_default_route relies on l23network (netconfig) task has been run.
However it's not required that the base-os role has run this, so it will
result in a failed deployment. If a plugin is using base-os then it will
need to determine if l23network/netconfig and configure_default_route

Closes-bug: #1452925
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove base os from configure_default_route

configure_default_route relies on l23network (netconfig) task has been run.
However it's not required that the base-os role has run this, so it will
result in a failed deployment. If a plugin is using base-os then it will
need to determine if l23network/netconfig and configure_default_route
need to run.

Change-Id: Ie734c4d8c1211a380405de0d8383c5d14b5d2f38
Closes-bug: #1452925

subject: Updates cleanup-containers
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-06 21:06:01.000000000', 'files': ['tools/cleanup-containers'], 'message': 'Updates cleanup-containers

Previously cleanup-containers suffered from the following
limitations:

1. The docker rm command would fail if all the containers were not
   stopped.
2. The script would throw an error if no containers existed.
3. Artifacts such as veths, bridges, etc.. would remain on the host
   after containers were removed. These artifacts should be removed
   if the containers are removed.

Change-Id: I5eadb23fec9e34125a32f6c3e39c241d97932910
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Updates cleanup-containers

Previously cleanup-containers suffered from the following
limitations:

1. The docker rm command would fail if all the containers were not
   stopped.
2. The script would throw an error if no containers existed.
3. Artifacts such as veths, bridges, etc.. would remain on the host
   after containers were removed. These artifacts should be removed
   if the containers are removed.

Change-Id: I5eadb23fec9e34125a32f6c3e39c241d97932910

commit_message:
Set port security for logical port

port_security is "a set of L2 (Ethernet) addresses
from which the logical port is allowed to send packets and to which it
is allowed to receive packets.
Logical ports are always allowed to receive packets
addressed to multicast and broadcast addresses."

Set this field with the port mac address and any configured
allowed address pairs mac addresses

Change-Id: I30b89f163f3941b8082e208c788aff94ef6f02db

commit_message:
Enable to specify auth plugin as full class name

This patch will enable us to specify auth_plugin as full class name (e.g.
keystoneclient.auth.identity.generic.Password) as well as plugin alias (
e.g. password ).
The implementation like this is used by Neutron plugin loading system.

Change-Id: Ieec767da6cfdd444843c9d9d66a422bd7b75d09e
Closes-Bug: #1425345

commit_message:
Add host id to cinder default section

Cinder volumes are associated with the cinder host that created them.
This unique host id can be changed in the conf file. This patch adds
support to allow that.

Change-Id: I9295ed1bfa24bfac8325bd347a92b5e334a31371
Closes-Bug: #1451967

commit_message:
Update diversity tag to be a fixed 6 month window

Use stackalytics start_date option along with setting release to all to
collect data for the past 6 months.

http://stackalytics.readthedocs.org/en/latest/userdoc/api_v1.0.html

Update note at the bottom of the page to point to validate_tags now that
it is in tree and used to apply the team:diverse-affiliation tag.

Change-Id: Id60feb69704e0569873108a18a39e7787c7ab4eb

Change-Id: I38e7c60ec602c33f74de237b6014b4ac13ee4985

commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I38e7c60ec602c33f74de237b6014b4ac13ee4985

commit_message:
Move install_infra before execute build_wheels.sh

The pip_install_gr function in build_wheels.sh use requirements project.
So requirements project must exist before execute build_wheels.sh.
Then we moved install_infra function which install requirements project.

Change-Id: I8f80ecafff0f7e1942731379b70bccac338ea3b3
Closes-Bug: 1453012

subject: Don't install tempest on stable kilo
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-07 16:00:24.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': "Don't install tempest on stable kilo

Because of branchless tempest when we run tempest in a devstack env on
a stable branch we have to ensure it is venv isolated. The
INSTALL_TEMPEST flag should default to false on stable branches
accordingly so we don't try to install tempest globally.

Change-Id: Ic5faf357ead936793063845113686b33d85413c0
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't install tempest on stable kilo

Because of branchless tempest when we run tempest in a devstack env on
a stable branch we have to ensure it is venv isolated. The
INSTALL_TEMPEST flag should default to false on stable branches
accordingly so we don't try to install tempest globally.

Change-Id: Ic5faf357ead936793063845113686b33d85413c0

commit_message:
Fix default route overwriting problem

* Add simple puppet resource which clear all default gateways
  before creating l3_ifconfig resources
* Add warnings to prevent from using 'ip route replace...'
  command in context of interface setup

Change-Id: Ifa73c0a9a4f4df542ea8437b9894c3dce5cfee7e
Related-bug: #1447638

commit_message:
Remove CLI testing once and for all

The cli tests have been marked for removal for ~6 months and the
framework was the first thing included in tempest lib. There has
been more than enough time for all the projects to pick this up
in the client repos. So let's remove it all!

As part of this a couple of missing entries for tempest's
requirements.txt were found. These dependencies were being installed
by the clients so the fact they were missing was never noticed prior
to this. This commit also adds these missing entries back into the
requirements file.

Change-Id: I4f8638f1c048bbdb598dd181f4af272ef9923806

commit_message:
Creating keystone user for collecting stats only for opted-in customer

We should create user only if customer opted-in to sending statistics.
Parameter with info about opt-in status was added to astute.yaml

commit_message:
Install priority pluging in rpm SANDBOX

Since we are using several repos with priorities in rpm SANDBOX,
we need to have this plugin inside it

Change-Id: Ib07ea4902e8e69ba2b05adfd197b9e24ef3e9c66
Implements blueprint: package-fuel-components

commit_message:
puppet: run beaker on both trusty & centos7

This patch aims to run Beaker on both Ubuntu & CentOS7 using nodepool,
without vagrant.

* Split beaker-rspec jobs in 2 (trusty & centos7) with a new job-group
* Switch from bare-trusty to devstack-trusty
* Ability to uninstall Puppet on YUM systems
* Ability to install beaker dependencies (Ruby & Devel tools) on YUM systems
* Delete beaker jobs where there is no beaker tests (save time &
  resources.)

Change-Id: I56b1e9b5554e5b56a8c20dacd0f89d4f0321edcc

commit_message:
libvirt: Use qemu as block driver for Xen instances

... instead of phy.

This will workaround an issue where a guest is not able to use the disk
when the backend for the disk is iscsi.

Change-Id: I67553953d16311a4d7f2d49e414c7d281b31e712
Closes-bug: #1445443

subject: Switch to pypowervm standard auth model
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-04 18:30:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/driver.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Switch to pypowervm standard auth model

This change set switches nova-powervm to utilize a base Session as the
authentication model for log in to the API.  This assumes that the
nova-powervm process has the right user permissions to use the API, and
that it is running on the server hosting the PowerVM API.

Change-Id: I07be4249d5ab06d95fcda85c8c6c48c67f85bcf6
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Switch to pypowervm standard auth model

This change set switches nova-powervm to utilize a base Session as the
authentication model for log in to the API.  This assumes that the
nova-powervm process has the right user permissions to use the API, and
that it is running on the server hosting the PowerVM API.

Change-Id: I07be4249d5ab06d95fcda85c8c6c48c67f85bcf6

commit_message:
Add support for building the appliance image during devstack deploy

This adds support for building the appliance VM image from source during
the devstack deployment.  The default behavior remains to pull it from
the specified URL but it may alternatively be built from source by
setting BUILD_AKANDA_DEV_APPLIANCE=True in local.conf.

Closes-bug: #1451654

Change-Id: I4cd2d37db305d1c316324ec515494cf37d489e3e

commit_message:
Switch to pypowervm standard auth model

This change set switches neutron-powervm to utilize a base Session as
the authentication model for log in to the API.  This assumes that the
neutron-powervm process has the right user permissions to use the API,
and that it is running on the server hosting the PowerVM API.

This change set also updates a test case so that it supports the new
pypowervm library updates.

Change-Id: I5eedfe9545d6f171af2a92f154841c1a371a269d

[{'created': '2015-04-20 10:17:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Migrate to oslo_context

This CR introduces oslo_context as a dependency, in order to be more
aligned with the rest of OpenStack. Although, due to the fact that we
had some extra fields in the context, the approach that I took was to
inherit from oslo_context's RequestContext and add the extra fields that
we needed.

I also removed the unused fields (which are related to the ownership and
the service catalog), which lead to also deleting the context middleware
tests; Since it was only one test and the functionality that it was
testing is no longer needed.

commit_message:
Migrate to oslo_context

This CR introduces oslo_context as a dependency, in order to be more
aligned with the rest of OpenStack. Although, due to the fact that we
had some extra fields in the context, the approach that I took was to
inherit from oslo_context's RequestContext and add the extra fields that
we needed.

I also removed the unused fields (which are related to the ownership and
the service catalog), which lead to also deleting the context middleware
tests; Since it was only one test and the functionality that it was
testing is no longer needed.

Change-Id: Id439a32f0d21fe7d8adafec71417a3e9d4870ec5

subject: Only import files if there are new translations
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-02 14:49:39.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/common_translation_update.sh'], 'message': "Only import files if there are new translations

Do not import files if only content is deleted but no new translation
added. If there's at least one file with added translations, files with
removed content are also imported.

This should reduce the number of imports, since a project should see an
import only if new strings are in transifex.

Change-Id: Id521a2209bf9cad3b90acf81447db027beed7b64
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Only import files if there are new translations

Do not import files if only content is deleted but no new translation
added. If there's at least one file with added translations, files with
removed content are also imported.

This should reduce the number of imports, since a project should see an
import only if new strings are in transifex.

Change-Id: Id521a2209bf9cad3b90acf81447db027beed7b64

subject: Add erasure code policy support to swift
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-27 02:56:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add erasure code policy support to swift

This patch is version 1 (not tested) of adding erasure code support
to swift. It adds the following:

  - Add policy_type, ec_type, ec_num_data_fragments,
    ec_num_parity_fragments and ec_object_segment_size to the
    policy definition.

  - Update the ring.contents.j2 to set replica count for the ring
    to ec_num_parity_fragments + ec_object_segment_size, if using
    the erasure code policy_type.

  - Adds extra EC options to swift.conf for EC policies.

I may have missed something and again this hasn't been tested yet.

NOTE: EC in Swift is strictly _BETA_ and shouldn't be run in
      production, however, we do need to test it!

Change-Id: If2069a95e6ea92e34fb329cb6e0027188f15f0bb

commit_message:
Add erasure code policy support to swift

This patch is version 1 (not tested) of adding erasure code support
to swift. It adds the following:

  - Add policy_type, ec_type, ec_num_data_fragments,
    ec_num_parity_fragments and ec_object_segment_size to the
    policy definition.

  - Update the ring.contents.j2 to set replica count for the ring
    to ec_num_parity_fragments + ec_object_segment_size, if using
    the erasure code policy_type.

  - Adds extra EC options to swift.conf for EC policies.

I may have missed something and again this hasn't been tested yet.

NOTE: EC in Swift is strictly _BETA_ and shouldn't be run in
      production, however, we do need to test it!

Change-Id: If2069a95e6ea92e34fb329cb6e0027188f15f0bb

commit_message:
Managed /etc/swift/backups using ansible

If the permissions on /etc/swift/backups are not swift.swift it can
cause the copying of the ring files to fail.

This patch adds /etc/swift/backups to the list of directories managed by
ansible when setting up/configuring swift.

Change-Id: I3937efc54f03e25f504937213a99bde19789aa59
Closes-Bug: #1452743
(cherry picked from commit 87d48cd4e26fec3ac062a1543ce62c8ce0ee3e54)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-29 20:23:06.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/ovsdb/commands.py'], 'message': 'Configure OVN port security

The current code sets macs for a logical port, but not port_security.
In OVN, macs is the set of destination MAC addresses used when
determining what packets should go to this port.  If we set the same
value in port_security, OVN will add some additional rules to restrict
ingress and egress packets to this set of MAC addresses (plus
broadcast/multicast).

Change-Id: I076eb22c1f75ab6d4e4469a6eb1377e028338b89
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Configure OVN port security

The current code sets macs for a logical port, but not port_security.
In OVN, macs is the set of destination MAC addresses used when
determining what packets should go to this port.  If we set the same
value in port_security, OVN will add some additional rules to restrict
ingress and egress packets to this set of MAC addresses (plus
broadcast/multicast).

Change-Id: I076eb22c1f75ab6d4e4469a6eb1377e028338b89

commit_message:
labs: Adds functions to edit config files

This patch adds a function to edit config files without a section parameter.
Current functions need a [section] to edit the config file. It also modifies
the iniset_sudo function to call this function when section is not specified.

Change-Id: Idc213676077622a438b5d96f831b77da5bd32528

commit_message:
Port PXE drivers to use the new boot interface

This patch split the provisioning part of the split the PXEDeploy
interface into two interfaces: PXEBoot and ISCSIDeploy. The PXEBoot
contains all the bits needed to boot a machine using PXE and the
ISCSIDeploy the bits needed to deploy a machine using the iSCSI
methodology.

The PXE VendorPassthru interface was renamed to PXEAndISCSIVendorPassthru
because it's a mix of both deploy and boot interface.

All the deploy parameters that before were part of the PXE template were
also separated and a new parameter "deploy_params" was created for deploy
drivers that needs to add deploy parameters in the PXE template.

And consenquently, all drivers that were using the PXEDeploy interface
had to be ported to use the new boot interface.

Implements blueprint new-boot-interface
Change-Id: Ic90642e3b967792472eb19c2b2e4fa6d7edf4a74

commit_message:
Add flag to indicate where floating ips come from

One of the things that's not possible to discover is where floating ips
come from. You'd think that looking for a neutron endpoint would do it,
but you'd be oh-so-wrong.

Change-Id: I10a0c6f37afb409af0078cede3eac2eaa0ff4f04

commit_message:
Use catalog=True for package_loader queries

Package loader attempts to load packages during deployment, therefore it
needs to see all the packages it can deploy, therefore it needs
catalog=True context for that.
This is related to api behaviour change, that allows packages api to
distinct between packages one can deploy and packages one can edit.

Change-Id: I5ffdc2728202f212408b9a5b4b6b267084c5723d
Closes-Bug: #1452942

commit_message:
Updated Juno for new dev cycle

The base change here is that Juno can now being using newer setuptools
and pip6. This is because the logical issues that prevented juno from
being able to upgrade in the past have been fully resolved upstream.

Glance store has also been pinned because there is no stable/juno
branch and we do not want the service to be upgraded oustide the
confines of what should would within Juno.

rackspace_monitoring_cli was updated because it had a packaging
problem in v6.0.6 that prevented from being built properly which was
overlooked in previous version of pip.

oslo.log needs to be updated to support tempest becuase pip6 is
for real resolving its deps where is wasn't so much in pip 1.5.6.

Closes-bug: 1452305
Change-Id: Ieeede35c8acf46b2ef27fa1e0e17944307c2d97f

[{'created': '2015-05-07 04:46:23.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_heat/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_tempest/tasks/tempest_install.yml', 'playbooks/vars/repo_packages/openstack_services.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_heat/tasks/heat_install_plugins.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_heat/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_tempest/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_tempest/templates/openstack_tempest_gate.sh.j2'], 'message': "Update the tempest install environment

While this should be backported this purpose of this commit
is to unblock gating and provide for the always changing
requirements within tempest while also allowing us to ensure
that we are defcore complaint.

Tempest is not an integrated service within OpenStack and does
not adhere to any given package or requirement set that would
in a real work function with the rest of OpenStack. Because
tempest is intended to be a standalone system that is not
installed along side of the rest of OpenStack it general will
break and or introduce new requirements that break the services
that depend on various versions of packages as found within
global requirements. To fix this issue tempest is now being
installed within a VENV. The virtual environment will ensure
that tempest is installed in a location where it can resolve
its own dependencies without general impact to the rest of the
